meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to make provision for the transfer between Hong Kong and places outside Hong Kong of persons detained in institutions by virtue of orders made by courts in the exercise of their criminal jurisdiction; and for matters incidental thereto or connected therewith.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Transfer of Sentenced Persons Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: ArrangementsForTheTransferOfSentencedPersons
def.leadIn: arrangements for the transfer of sentenced persons (移交被判刑人士的安排) means arrangements—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Government and the government of a place outside the People’s Republic of China; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Hong Kong and a place outside the People’s Republic of China; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Government of the Macao Special Administrative Region and the Government; and (Added 13 of 2005 s. 3. Amended 31 of 2025 s. 138)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of— (Amended 13 of 2005 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the transfer of a sentenced person or sentenced persons to Hong Kong from that place or from Macao; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the transfer of a sentenced person or sentenced persons to that place or to Macao from Hong Kong; (Amended 13 of 2005 s. 3; 31 of 2025 s. 138)

section.def: inward warrant (移交入境手令) means a warrant issued under section 3(1)(a);
outward warrant (移交出境手令) means a warrant issued under section 3(1)(b);

def.name: Sentence
def.leadIn: sentence (刑、刑罰) means any punishment or measure involving the deprivation of liberty ordered by a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a limited, unlimited or indeterminate period of time; and (Amended 32 of 2000 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the course of the exercise of its criminal jurisdiction;

section.def: sentenced person (被判刑人士) means a person who is required to be detained in an institution to serve a sentence.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 4, the Chief Executive may, pursuant to any arrangements for the transfer of sentenced persons, issue a warrant in the form specified in Schedule 1 providing for the transfer of a sentenced person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: into Hong Kong from the place outside Hong Kong to which those arrangements are applicable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the place outside Hong Kong to which those arrangements are applicable.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive shall not issue an inward warrant unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acts or omissions constituting the conduct in respect of which the sentence was imposed amount to conduct which, if the conduct had occurred in Hong Kong, would constitute a criminal offence under the law of Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: holds a permanent identity card within the meaning of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the opinion of the Chief Executive, otherwise has close ties with Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: life;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an indeterminate period; or (Amended 32 of 2000 s. 25)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a fixed period;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no further criminal proceedings relating to the sentenced person in respect of the conduct which gave rise to the sentence imposed are pending in the place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong and the sentenced person (or a person acting on his behalf) have consented to the transfer.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive shall not issue an outward warrant unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acts or omissions constituting the conduct in respect of which the sentence was imposed amount to conduct which, if the conduct had occurred in the place outside Hong Kong, would constitute a criminal offence under the law of that place;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a transfer to a place outside the People’s Republic of China, the sentenced person is a national of that place or, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, otherwise has close ties with that place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a transfer to Macao, the sentenced person is a permanent resident of Macao or, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, otherwise has close ties with Macao; (Replaced 13 of 2005 s. 4. Amended 31 of 2025 s. 139)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: life;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an indeterminate period; or (Amended 32 of 2000 s. 25)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a fixed period;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no further criminal proceedings relating to the sentenced person in respect of the conduct which gave rise to the sentence imposed are pending in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an appropriate authority of Hong Kong and the sentenced person (or a person acting on his behalf) have consented to the transfer.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Transfers into and out of Hong Kong

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the bringing of the sentenced person into Hong Kong from the place outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the taking of the sentenced person to the institution in Hong Kong which is specified in the warrant; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the detention of the sentenced person in accordance with the terms of the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not specify that the sentenced person is to be detained beyond the date, if any, which the place outside Hong Kong has advised is the termination date of the sentence imposed.

subsection.leadIn: An outward warrant shall be sufficient authority for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the taking of the sentenced person from an institution in Hong Kong and his delivery into the custody of an escorting officer representing the appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the removal of the sentenced person by the escorting officer to the place outside Hong Kong.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is in custody by virtue of an inward or outward warrant escapes out of custody; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who has been removed from Hong Kong by virtue of an outward warrant returns to Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the completion of the sentence imposed on him in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: without the consent in writing of the Chief Executive,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in either case, the sentenced person may be taken in Hong Kong in like manner as a person who has escaped from a prison in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of paragraph (b), subject to subsection (4), the sentenced person, if so taken, shall serve in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the unexpired portion of that sentence remaining to be served commencing on the date on which he is so taken; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: all or so much of the period—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: between the date on which, for whatever reason, he ceased to serve that sentence in the place outside Hong Kong concerned and the date referred to in subparagraph (A); and

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: as the Chief Executive directs in writing that he shall so serve.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prevent the Chief Executive from issuing a further outward warrant in respect of the sentenced person referred to in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prejudice the exercise by any person (whether or not the Chief Executive) of any power under any law to pardon the sentenced person or commute or otherwise shorten all or any part of the sentence referred to in that subsection.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Chief Executive may, by direction in writing, revoke or vary an inward or outward warrant.

Where the term of the sentence imposed on a sentenced person the subject of an inward or outward warrant has been commuted or reduced, the Chief Executive shall under subsection (1) revoke or vary that warrant to give effect to the commutation or reduction, as the case may be.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transit
section.leadIn: Where a place outside Hong Kong wishes to transport in custody through Hong Kong a sentenced person who is being taken to that place from another place outside Hong Kong for the purposes of serving in that first-mentioned place a sentence imposed on him in that second-mentioned place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person may be transported in custody through Hong Kong for those purposes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a police officer (or any other person belonging to a class of persons authorized in writing by the Chief Executive for the purposes of this section) may, for the purposes of such transport, hold that person in custody for not more than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 48 hours; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such further period as is permitted in writing by the Chief Executive.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Chief Executive to give notice to Central People’s Government in relation to relevant requests

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall cause the Central People’s Government to be given notice of every relevant request.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Central People’s Government issues an instruction to the Chief Executive to take, or not to take, an action—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a relevant request; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the ground that if the instruction were not complied with the interests of the People’s Republic of China in matters of sovereignty, security or public order would be significantly affected,

subsection.continued: then the Chief Executive shall comply with that instruction.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (2), a relevant request shall not be complied with until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiration of the relevant period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Central People’s Government advises the Chief Executive that the request may be complied with,

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a copy of the relevant request;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: copies of the accompanying documents;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a summary of the material facts supporting the request;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: particulars of any places through which the sentenced person will be transported; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: such other documents relating to the request as may be required by the Central People’s Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if not already provided by virtue of paragraph (a), clearly identify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person making the request;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the sentenced person; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a request referred to in—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: paragraph (a) of the definition of relevant request, the place from which it is proposed to transfer the sentenced person into Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: paragraph (b) of that definition, the place to which it is proposed to transfer the sentenced person from Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: paragraph (c) of that definition, the places from and to which it is proposed to transport the sentenced person in custody through Hong Kong; (Amended 13 of 2005 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if not already provided by virtue of paragraph (a), state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the acts or omissions constituting the conduct in respect of which the sentence was imposed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the sentence imposed;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the period of that sentence already served by the sentenced person; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: if that sentence is a fixed period, the date on which the sentenced person will cease to serve that sentence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a request referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of relevant request, and if not already provided by virtue of paragraph (a), provide a copy of the sentenced person’s (or a person acting on his behalf) consent to the transfer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of a request referred to in paragraph (c) of the definition of relevant request, and if not already provided by virtue of paragraph (a) and if practicable, state particulars of the time the sentenced person is to be transported in custody through Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a request referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of relevant request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: state the basis on which the request is being made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: state advice with reasons whether the request may be complied with.

subsection.content: Where a relevant request has been complied with, the Chief Executive shall, if the Central People’s Government so requires, provide the Central People’s Government with particulars of any evidence or documents provided pursuant to the request.

subsection.def: relevant period (有關的期間), in relation to a relevant request, means the period commencing on the receipt of the request and expiring upon the elapse of such number of days as are agreed in writing from time to time by the Central People’s Government and the Chief Executive for the purposes of this definition;

def.name: RelevantRequest
def.leadIn: relevant request (有關的要求) means— (Amended 13 of 2005 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a request to issue an outward warrant for the transfer of a sentenced person from Hong Kong to a place outside Hong Kong other than Macao; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a request to transport in custody through Hong Kong a sentenced person from a place outside Hong Kong (other than Macao) to another place outside Hong Kong (other than Macao). (Amended 13 of 2005 s. 5; 31 of 2025 s. 140)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sentenced person is in custody in Hong Kong by virtue of a warrant issued under the Repatriation of Prisoners (Overseas Territories) Order 1986 (App. III, p. C1)*; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the sentence to be served by that person has not expired on or before the date on which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any arrangements for the transfer of sentenced persons come into operation between Hong Kong and the place outside Hong Kong from which that person was brought into Hong Kong pursuant to the warrant; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that Order ceases to be part of the law of Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: then that warrant shall be deemed to be an inward warrant issued under this Ordinance on that date in respect of the unexpired portion of that sentence remaining to be served after that date, and the other provisions of this Ordinance (including section 6) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If any sentenced person who has been removed from Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by virtue of a warrant issued under the Repatriation of Prisoners (Overseas Territories) Order 1986 (App. III, p. C1)*; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the completion of the sentence imposed on him in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: without the consent in writing of the Chief Executive,

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the sentenced person may be taken in Hong Kong in like manner as a person who has escaped from a prison in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), the sentenced person, if so taken, shall serve in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the unexpired portion of that sentence remaining to be served commencing on the date on which he is so taken; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: all or so much of the period—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: between the date on which, for whatever reason, he ceased to serve that sentence in the place outside Hong Kong concerned and the date referred to in subparagraph (A); and

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: as the Chief Executive directs in writing that he shall so serve.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prevent the Chief Executive from issuing an outward warrant in respect of the sentenced person referred to in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prejudice the exercise by any person (whether or not the Chief Executive) of any power under any law to pardon the sentenced person or commute or otherwise shorten all or any part of the sentence referred to in that subsection.

editorialNote.content: * Please also see section 3 of Schedule 2.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Inward and Outward Warrants

tr.td: To the Commissioner of Correctional Services and to each and all of the officers acting under his orders.

Whereas, pursuant to the Transfer of Sentenced Persons Ordinance (Cap. 513), this warrant authorizes the bringing into Hong Kong of . (name of sentenced person) from . (name of the place outside Hong Kong) to . (name of institution) to serve in Hong Kong the sentence imposed on him in the said place [until . (date on which the said sentence terminates)]*:

YOU, THE SAID OFFICERS, ARE HEREBY COMMANDED to take the said sentenced person and to safely convey him to the said institution, and there deliver him to the Commissioner of Correctional Services, together with this warrant:

YOU, THE SAID COMMISSIONER OF CORRECTIONAL SERVICES, ARE HEREBY COMMANDED to receive the said sentenced person into your custody, and detain him to serve the said sentence [until the said date]*; and for your so doing this shall be sufficient warrant.

schedule.text: * Delete if the sentence imposed is for life.

tr.td: To the Commissioner of Correctional Services, to each and all of the officers acting under his orders and to the escorting officer representing the appropriate authority of the place outside Hong Kong.

Whereas, pursuant to the Transfer of Sentenced Persons Ordinance (Cap. 513), this warrant authorizes the taking of . (name of sentenced person) from . (name of institution) and his delivery into the custody of the said escorting officer for the purposes of his removal to . (name of the place outside Hong Kong) to serve in the said place the sentence imposed on him in Hong Kong:

YOU, THE SAID COMMISSIONER OF CORRECTIONAL SERVICES, ARE HEREBY COMMANDED to release the said sentenced person from the said institution into the custody of the said officers for the delivery of the said sentenced person to the said escorting officer, together with this warrant:

YOU, THE SAID OFFICERS, ARE HEREBY COMMANDED to take the said sentenced person and to safely convey him to the said escorting officer, and there deliver him into the custody of the said escorting officer, together with this warrant:

td.p: YOU, THE SAID ESCORTING OFFICER, ARE HEREBY COMMANDED to remove the said sentenced person to the said place; and for your so doing this shall be sufficient warrant.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Sections 1 to 9 of the Repatriation of Prisoners Act 1984 as modified and adapted
section.content:
The Repatriation of Prisoners (Overseas Territories) Order 1986 (App. III, p. C1), in so far as it is part of the law of Hong Kong, is amended, in Schedule 1, by adding—
“8A.ApplicationThis Act shall not apply as between Hong Kong and a place outside Hong Kong where any arrangements for the transfer of sentenced persons, within the meaning of section 2 of the Transfer of Sentenced Persons Ordinance (51 of 1997 Hong Kong), are in operation between Hong Kong and that place.”.
